about_the_game:
The steel rails twist and climb relentlessly upward from the heart of the Sacramento River Valley, cross ancient lava fields under the shadow of 14,179-foot Mount Shasta, then descent through the wide-open high plains of the Lower Klamath Basin. Famous and fabulous, the railroad is the rugged Black Butte Subdivision of Southern Pacific’s Mount Shasta Line.

From High Iron Simulations, Mount Shasta Line Scenario Pack 01 brings to life the memorable Southern Pacific railroading of the 1980s and 1990s – with ten new and authentic career scenarios on the popular Train Simulator Classic Mount Shasta Line route!

Mount Shasta Line Scenario Pack 01 features the diverse challenges of handling heavy tonnage on grades of more than 2.2 percent, of taming first- and second-generation Electro-Motive and General Electric diesel power, of hustling intermodal traffic at a mile-a-minute pace, and of keeping Amtrak’s famed Coast Starlight on schedule.

With Mount Shasta Line Scenario Pack 01, you’ll experience:

  • Climbing into the cab and engineer’s seat of Southern Pacific’s General Electric U33C, EMD SD40T-2, SD45T-2, and SD9E diesels, as well as Amtrak’s landmark EMD F40PH as you move diverse rail traffic across SP’s extraordinary Black Butte Subdivision.
  • With power front and rear on a heavy manifest freight, making the steep climb from Dunsmuir, California, through the Sacramento River Valley to the 5,063-foot summit at Grass Lake, then hustling across the other-worldly lava flow country to Klamath Falls, Oregon.
  • Bringing a freight off SP’s famed Siskiyou Line at Black Butte and making the treacherous descent of the Sacramento River Valley to Dunsmuir, including passage around the twisting and steep Cantara Loops.
  • Stepping aboard Southern Pacific’s classic first-generation SD9E “Cadillacs” to handle the Black Butte Subdivision’s south-end Weed Local and the north-end Macdoel Local.
  • Taking the throttle of Amtrak EMD F40PHs for an early morning climb over the full length of the Mount Shasta Line with Amtrak’s magnificent Superliner-equipped Coast Starlight.
  • Bringing to life the short-but-fascinating era of red-and-yellow “Kodachrome” livery diesels on the Southern Pacific as you handle a heavy manifest out of Klamath Falls.
  • On a wintry day and under the gaze of towering 14,179-foot Mount Shasta, taking a priority intermodal piggyback train up and over the summit of the Black Butte Division.

The ten career scenarios of Mount Shasta Line Scenario Pack 01, based closely on actual railroad operations and train symbols, offers a remarkable and compelling opportunity to experience realistic American western mountain railroading.

Note: For full use, this scenario pack requires the Train Simulator Mount Shasta Line: Dunsmuir- Klamath Falls Route Add-On; Southern Pacific U33C Loco Add-On; Southern Pacific SD45T-2 Loco Add-On; and Amtrak F40PH ‘California Zephyr’ Loco Add-On. All required content is available at the Steam store.

Spectacular and authentic railroading – on Southern Pacific’s scenic and challenging Black Butte Subdivision – will be yours with the Train Simulator Classic Mount Shasta Line Scenario Pack 01, now available from High Iron Simulations!

Included Scenarios

  • SP LABRF, Pt. 1
  • SP LABRF, Pt. 2
  • SP LABRF, Pt. 3
  • SP Siskiyou Freight
  • SP Weed Local
  • SP Macdoel Duty
  • Amtrak Coast Starlight, Pt. 1
  • Amtrak Coast Starlight, Pt. 1
  • SP EUWCY
  • SP RVKFM

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum for 32-bit:
  • OS *: 32-bit Windows 7 Service Pack 1, 8.1 or 10 Required (Other OS versions and types are not supported)
  • Processor: Intel Core-i3 4330 3.50 GHz Dual Core or AMD A8 6600K 3.90 GHz Quad Core or Better
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 750 Ti or AMD Radeon R9 Graphics with 1 GB Dedicated VRAM or Better
  • DirectX®: 9.0c
  • Network: Broadband Connection (May incur additional costs for use)
  • Storage: 40 GB or more available space (Additional Add-Ons will require more)
  • Sound Card: DirectX Compatible Audio Device
  • Additional Notes: Requires mouse and keyboard or Xbox Controller
Laptop, Notebook, Mobile or Low Power versions of the above specifications (including Intel or Integrated Graphics) may work but are not supported. Updates to Chipset, Graphics and Audio Device Drivers may be required. For information relating to recommended specifications for Train Simulator 64-bit, please refer to the Train Simulator 2022 User Guide.
